channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Covid: Israel to impose travel ban for foreigners over new variant
item.description: Travellers from all countries will be banned from entering Israel for 14 days, local media report.

item.title: Covid: Netherlands enters partial lockdown amid surging infections
item.description: The government says the three-week curbs are critical to protect hospitals from becoming overwhelmed.

item.title: The migrants returned to Iraqi camps from Belarus
item.description: Three specially chartered planes have now returned 1,000 migrants from Belarus to Iraq.

item.title: Hondurans vote to replace controversial leader
item.description: A former first lady and a man convicted of corruption vie to succeed an unpopular president.

item.title: 'Why do you like Shah Rukh Khan?'
item.description: The Bollywood superstar's female fandom rests not on love but on economics, according to a new book.

item.title: Peng Shuai: WTA concerned over 'censorship or coercion'
item.description: The head of women's tennis says he is not certain Peng Shuai is free of Chinese censorship or coercion.

item.title: Burkina Faso: Tear gas fired at protesters decrying Islamist attacks
item.description: The protest comes amid fear of an Islamist encroachment following a number of recent attacks.

item.title: Pre-Inca mummy found in Peru
item.description: Archaeologists think the mummy, found near Lima, could be up to 1,200 years old.

item.title: Covid: Swiss vote on ending restrictions while cases surge
item.description: Sunday's referendum is held in a country with one of the lowest vaccination rates in Western Europe.

item.title: Musical theatre icon Stephen Sondheim dies at 91
item.description: The US composer and lyricist reshaped America's musical theatre in a career spanning over 60 years.

item.title: Covid: South Africa 'punished' for detecting new Omicron variant
item.description: South Africa should be praised for discovering Omicron, not hit with travel bans, its officials say.

item.title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: Zelensky alleges coup plan involving Russians
item.description: He says an alleged plan to overthrow his government comes amid threats of a Russian invasion.

item.title: Egypt: Grand opening for Luxor's 'Avenue of the Sphinxes'
item.description: The ancient walkway, connecting two of the Egyptian city's greatest temples, took decades to excavate.

item.title: Dramatic rescue of 300 from migrant boat in Italy
item.description: Some people were already in the water when the Italian coastguard reached them off Lampedusa Island.

item.title: ‘I’m blind but technology helps me animate’
item.description: Elodie Bateson, 11, from Limavady who is blind has become an expert at making short animated movies.

item.title: Yemen: The woman saving a crumbling heritage
item.description: Its famous architecture has been wrecked by war - now a female engineer is rebuilding amid the conflict.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'home comforts'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Nigerian celebrities Simi and Chigul expose sexism in music and Nollywood
item.description: Singer Simi and Nollywood's Chigul tell the BBC about the cultural hurdles female stars face.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Can US troops be punished for refusing the jabs?
item.description: The US military has said that America's 2.1 million soldiers and sailors must all get the vaccine.

item.title: The gangs enticing migrants to cross the English Channel
item.description: The BBC has uncovered evidence showing that smugglers are still telling migrants it is safe to cross.

item.title: ICYMI: Smells like Christmas, confirms US First Lady
item.description: Jill Biden's clearly feeling festive but here’s some other tree-mendous moments you may have missed this week.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... Migrants crossing English Channel to UK
item.description: This week at least 27 migrants died while trying to make the journey, the deadliest crossing on record.

item.title: Covid variant: Reaction to new rules on travel from southern Africa
item.description: Travellers at Cape Town airport respond to new UK quarantine measures over Covid variant.

item.title: Inside Dunkirk's new migrant camp
item.description: Last week French police officers evicted up to 1,500 people from a camp in Dunkirk.
